text: Harmonic means are a type of mean. It is the number of values divided by the reciprocal of the values. If there are N numbers X_1,X_2,X_3...X_N, then the harmonic mean of these numbers are \frac{N}{\frac{1}{X_1}+\frac{1}{X_2}+\frac{1}{X_3}+\dots + \frac{1}{X_N}} Out of the geometric mean and arithmetic mean, the harmonic mean is usually the smallest. == Example == Let's find the harmonic mean of 2,4 and 5. There are three numbers so we will be dividing three. The reciprocals of the numbers are \frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{4} and \frac{1}{5}. If we add the reciprocals we get \frac{19}{20}. If we divide three by this number, the result is \frac{60}{19} (approximately 3.157894737) ==References== Category:Statistics Category:Mathematical analysis
title: Harmonic mean
